answers.answer: Hello,Burning feet can have several different causes like you may be having sensitivity to the fabric or leather dye in your shoes or socks, or even the detergent used to wash your socks. Also it can be due to improper socks textile.Are youhaving regular periods? Hot flushes and burning feet and legs are common in premenopausal syndrome. As you are 47 years of age and having these symptoms,so the chances of premenopause are more.The normal age range for the occurrence of menopause is somewhere between the age of 45 and 55. During premenopause, the production of most of the reproductive hormones, including the estrogens, progesterone and testosterone, diminishes and becomes more irregular, often with wide and unpredictable fluctuations in levels,resulting in various symptoms;some of which you are experiencing.If premenopausal,you need Hormone replacement Therapy.But burning legs and feet can also be  due to mainly Peripheral Neuropathy. Burning is one symptom of peripheral neuropathy. . Diabetes is one of the most important cause.Pls get your blood sugar levels evaluated to rule out diabetes. Alcohol abuse and nutritional deficiencies, such as vitamin B-12 deficiency anemia are also important causes.Other causes of burning feet and legs include hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidism, kidney and liver disorders or underlying neurological disorder.I feel that evaluation along with investigations  by a gynecologist and physician are required to make a diagnosis.Pls get it done.Hope it helps.Take care and pls do keep us posted on how you are doing.
